answers.answer: Hi!Since you have a history of DVT, have purple patches and bruises, you probably have wide spread DVT, clots etc in major vessels of the leg. You need a dopplar study to find out the extent of involvement. High blood pressure, heart problems, kidney and liver dysfunction, and diabetes should be ruled out. Deep vein thrombosis is treatable, both medically and surgically. Stockings (tight compression) to press the lower extremity to aid circulation and medicines help many. If you take these medicines and wear the stockings, the pain will reduce considerably. Do not walk for prolonged time. Do not stand at one place for a long time. If you need to, then keep moving your legs. Avoid weight gain and eat healthy.The other possibility is pinched nerves in lower back. This can be diagnosed by MRI and nerve conduction studies.Since a confirmed diagnosis cannot be given on net please consult your doctor regarding this. Hope this helps.
